etomica.lattice

Interface FiniteLattice

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AbstractLattice
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CellLattice, RectangularLattice

    public interface FiniteLattice
extends AbstractLattice
    Interface for a lattice that has a finite, adjustable size. Size is quantified by the maximum value of the index in each dimension. Provides a method that permits all sites of the lattice to be returned in a 1-D array of objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] getSize()
      Returns an array with elements giving the maximum number of index values in each dimension.
      void setSize(int[] size)
      Sets the array size, defined as described in the getSize method.
      java.lang.Object[] sites()
      Returns an array containing all the sites in the lattice.

      • Methods inherited from interface etomica.lattice.AbstractLattice

        D, site

    • Method Detail

      • sites

        java.lang.Object[] sites()
        Returns an array containing all the sites in the lattice.

      • getSize

        int[] getSize()
        Returns an array with elements giving the maximum number of index values in each dimension. If size[i] = k, then permissible values of index[i] are in the range (0, k-1) inclusive, where index is the index array given to the site method of AbstractLattice.

      • setSize

        void setSize(int[] size)
        Sets the array size, defined as described in the getSize method.
